articles.description: Contrary to expectations of a massive surplus transfer to the government, the central bank raised its Contingent Risk Buffer (CRB) by 50 basis points to 6%, when the Economic Capital Framework adopted in 2019 prescribed the 5.5% to 6.5% range.
articles.content: Mumbai: For the Reserve Bank of India (RBI), FY23 - theoretically a year of adversity - turned into one of advantage. As the custodian of currency value, it was on a sticky wicket to see it plunge to… [+3379 chars]

articles.title: Should one hop onto the IRCTC train after a strong Q4? - Moneycontrol
articles.description: In the past one year this railway stock has given a negative return of 7 percent. Is it time to start buying it once again?
articles.content:
From Rs 731 in December 2022, shares of Indian Railway Catering and Tourism Corporation (IRCTC) have fallen to Rs 643. That makes for a decline of 12 percent.
